# Chord: Major 7b5 in B (Shape: G)

## Description
The Major 7b5 chord in the key of B, played with the shape of a G chord, consists of the notes B, D#, F#, and A. This chord combines the major 7th quality with a lowered 5th, creating a unique and dissonant sound.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- D# (Major 3rd)
- F# (Diminished 5th)
- A (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7b5 chord is often used in jazz and fusion genres to introduce tension and color to harmonic progressions. Its dissonant and intriguing sound adds complexity and depth to compositions, making it a favorite among adventurous musicians and composers looking to push the boundaries of traditional harmony.
